paw_structure.tra¶

Trajectory file handling and data storage.

Dependencies:

numpy pandas utility

Snap(iter, time, cell, pos, atoms[, …])

Information storage.

tra_detect_change(snapshots)

Detect changes in atoms contained in a snapshot and save index of snapshots between which the change occurs.

tra_extract(root, n_atoms)

Extract raw data from trajectory file “_r.tra”.

tra_index(times, t1, t2, n)

Indices of snapshots closest to equally spaced times in a given interval.

tra_load(root)

Load information previously saved by tra_save().

tra_number_atoms(snapshots)

Get atom number, time and iteration from multiple snapshots.

tra_read(root, t1, t2, n)

Read the trajectory file and extract relevant information for selected snapshots.

tra_save(root, snapshots)

Save information of selected snapshots to file “.snap”.

tra_strc_read(root)

Read “.strc_out” file to obtain atom identifiers.
class paw_structure.tra.Snap(iter, time, cell, pos, atoms, dataframe=None, hbonds=None)¶

Information storage.

Contains the relevant information for one snapshot taken from the simulation.

Parameters

  • iter (int) – iteration in simulation

  • time (float) – time [ps] in simulation

  • cell (ndarray[float]) – 3x3 array containing the unit cell of simulation

  • pos (ndarray[float]) – 3xN array containing atomic positions (select None if dataframe is given)

  • atoms (dict) – atomic information (name, id, index) (select None if dataframe is given)

  • dataframe (pandas DataFrame, optional) – contains atoms and pos input (selection with ‘name’, ‘id’, ‘index’, ‘pos’)

  • hbonds (dict, optional) – NOT IN USE; hydrogen bond information

iter¶

see above

Type

int

time¶

see above

Type

float

cell¶

see above

Type

ndarray[float]

atoms¶

combination of atoms and pos input or equal to dataframe input if given

Type

pandas DataFrame

hbonds¶

default is None

Type

dict, optional

paw_structure.tra.tra_detect_change(snapshots)¶

Detect changes in atoms contained in a snapshot and save index of snapshots between which the change occurs.

Parameters

snapshots (list[Snap]) – snapshots containing the atoms

Returns

indices of snapshots where atoms change

Return type

ndarray[int]

paw_structure.tra.tra_extract(root, n_atoms)¶

Extract raw data from trajectory file “_r.tra”.

Parameters

  • root (str) – root name of the trajectory file

  • n_atoms (int) – number of atoms per snapshot

Returns

data structure containing information

Return type

ndarray

For formatting of the trajectory file please see the manual for the CP-PAW code by Peter Blöchl.

The units are transformed into ps (time) and Angstrom (distance) at this step.

Note

Unit cell reading not clear if correct or transpose (not relevant for simple cubic).

paw_structure.tra.tra_index(times, t1, t2, n)¶

Indices of snapshots closest to equally spaced times in a given interval.

Parameters

  • times (ndarray[float]) – simulation times

  • t1 (float) – beginning of interval

  • t2 (float) – end of interval

  • n (int) – number of wanted snapshots

Returns

index of the selected snapshots

Return type

list[int]

paw_structure.tra.tra_load(root)¶

Load information previously saved by tra_save().

Parameters

root (root) – root name of file

Returns

snapshots loaded from file

Return type

list[Snap]

Note

Reading is line sensitive. Do not alter the output file before loading.

paw_structure.tra.tra_number_atoms(snapshots)¶

Get atom number, time and iteration from multiple snapshots.

Parameters

snapshots (list[Snap]) – snapshots the atomic information

Returns

tuple containing:

  • list[int]: number of atoms in each snapshot

  • list[float]: time in simulation of the snapshots

  • list[int]: iteration in simulation of the snapshots

Return type

(tuple)

paw_structure.tra.tra_read(root, t1, t2, n)¶

Read the trajectory file and extract relevant information for selected snapshots.

Parameters

  • root (str) – root name of the trajectory file

  • t1 (float) – beginning of interval

  • t2 (float) – end of interval

  • n (int) – number of wanted snapshots

Returns

snapshots extracted from the trajectory file

Return type

list[Snap]

paw_structure.tra.tra_save(root, snapshots)¶

Save information of selected snapshots to file “.snap”.

Parameters

  • root (str) – root name for file

  • snapshots (list[Snap]) – snapshots to be saved

XXX REFERENCE TO FILE DESCRIPTION .snap XXX

Note

Not suitable for dynamic / changing unit cells.

paw_structure.tra.tra_strc_read(root)¶

Read “.strc_out” file to obtain atom identifiers.

Necessary to correctly identify atomic positions extracted from the trajectory file.

Parameters

root (str) – root name of the file

Returns

contains information ‘name’, ‘id’, ‘index’ of all the atoms

Return type

pandas DataFrame
